body: I've hit this as well after deleting my kind cluster but still pointing to it in kubeconfig

issue.body:
Errors relating to initializing the action config cause helm to exit silently,
except when in debug mode. This now emits the useful error.

Closes #6863

issue.title: feat(helm): Add map of cmds that req actionConfig

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.body:
Most commands unrelated to release do not require actionConfig. This
provides a way to differentiate between commands that use it and those
that do not, so that a user doesn't need to worry about their kubeconfig
if they are running `helm version` for example.

This feature was suggested in #6863 .

Signed-off-by: Jorge Gasca <jorge.ignacio.gasca@gmail.com>

issue.title: [helm3] unknown subcommand should return a error

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: v3.x
labels.description: Issues and Pull Requests related to the major version v3

issue.body:
<!-- If you need help or think you have found a bug, please help us with your issue by entering the following information (otherwise you can delete this text): -->

The output of `helm version`:

```
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.0.0", GitCommit:"e29ce2a54e96cd02ccfce88bee4f58bb6e2a28b6", GitTreeState:"clean", GoVersion:"go1.13.4"}
```

There is no error raised if I passed an unknown subcommand to Helm 3, no error message and the exit code is 0.
It's really hard to find out what is going wrong when I was debugging a helm 2 plugin. there supposed to be an error message to tell me which subcommand does not exist.

issue.title: Installing helm 3 on a circleci machine, the executable exits with a return code 1
issue.body:
When installing helm 3 on a CircleCI machine or docker image, the helm executable will only returns an exit code of 1 with no output, whatever what the arguments are

Output of `helm version`: nothing. Only a return code of 1. But the installed version is 3.0.0

Output of `kubectl version`: 1.6.3, but shouldn't be relevant as no contact with the cluster is made

Cloud Provider/Platform (AKS, GKE, Minikube etc.):  baremetal, but shouldn't be relevant as no contact with the cluster is made

issue.title: invalid path for --kubeconfig parameter causes exit without any output

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

issue.body:
Output of `helm version`:
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.0.0", GitCommit:"e29ce2a54e96cd02ccfce88bee4f58bb6e2a28b6", GitTreeState:"clean", GoVersion:"go1.13.4"}

Output of `kubectl version`:
irrelevant
Cloud Provider/Platform (AKS, GKE, Minikube etc.): 
irrelevant


The following command 
`helm install chartname ./dir/to/chart --kubeconfig kubeconfig-name`
fails without any error output if the path to kubeconfig is invalid.

adding --debug shows:
> helm.go:71: [debug] CreateFile kubeconfig-name: Das System kann die angegebene Datei nicht finden.

(Translated to English: The System cannot find the specified file)

I would expect the helm install command to output a error message if helm can't find the specified file

issue.title: Invalid kubectl context results in helm3 commands failing without output.
issue.body:
If the current Kubernetes context is set to something invalid, helm commands silently fail, even `helm version`.

> [root@bf0a9f1ee606 build]# kubectl config current-context
> frodo
> [root@bf0a9f1ee606 build]# kubectl config get-contexts | grep -c frodo
> 0
> [root@bf0a9f1ee606 build]# helm version
> [root@bf0a9f1ee606 build]# echo $?
> 1

I thought there was a problem with my helm3 installation, based on the lack of output from `helm version`.  We should be able to query helm for its version regardless of what kubectl context is set to.

issue.title: Why error message only show in debug ?
Helm exit silently if kube config is directory

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

issue.body:
Output of `helm version`:
`version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.0.1", GitCommit:"7c22ef9ce89e0ebeb7125ba2ebf7d421f3e82ffa", GitTreeState:"clean", GoVersion:"go1.13.4"}`

Make directory `~/.kube/config`. Try to run even just `helm version`. Got exit code 1 without any errors.

For example `kubectl` provide the following error message:
`error: error loading config file "~/.kube/config": read ~/.kube/config: is a directory`

issue.title: Helm 3.x on Windows does not provide any output
issue.body:
Output of `helm version`: nothing (should display 3.0.2)

Output of `kubectl version`: Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"15", GitVersion:"v1.15.0", GitCommit:"e8462b5b5dc2584fdcd18e6bcfe9f1e4d970a529", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-06-19T16:40:16Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.5", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"windows/amd64"}

Installing an using Helm3 on Windows does not return any output. (i.e. version, help, list, etc.)
Using Helm2 it works and displays output accordingly.

Could you please help.
Thanks

Best regards
miracle152004

issue.title: helm 3 fails silently in case of "malformed" kubeconfig
issue.body:
Helm3 fails silently if it cannot read cluster from kubeconfig file:

```
$ helm3 version; echo $?
1
```

Affected version:

```
$ helm3 --kube-context=gullfaxi version
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.0.2", GitCommit:"19e47ee3283ae98139d98460de796c1be1e3975f", GitTreeState:"clean", GoVersion:"go1.13.5"}
```

I deliberately put `current-context: none` into `~/.kube/config` - this forces me to specify `--kube-context` and `--context` for helm2 and kubectl - this way I have less chances to apply manifests to a wrong cluster. Both helm2 and kubectl produce sane errors if I forgot to specify a context for a command:

```
$ helm version
Client: &version.Version{SemVer:"v2.14.3", GitCommit:"0e7f3b6637f7af8fcfddb3d2941fcc7cbebb0085", GitTreeState:"clean"}
Error: could not get Kubernetes config for context "": invalid configuration: context was not found for specified context: none
$ kubectl version
Error in configuration: context was not found for specified context: none
```

I expect the same behavior from helm3

W/A: remove `current-context` from kubeconfig

issue.title: Helm broken after installation (Helm 3)
issue.body:
<!-- If you need help or think you have found a bug, please help us with your issue by entering the following information (otherwise you can delete this text): -->

Output of `helm version`:

Can't output, `helm version` return nothing.

Output of `kubectl version`:

Not needed, Helm seems not working even when just typing `helm` in my console.

```
(base) krustyhack@KrustyMSI:~/linux-amd64$ ls
helm  LICENSE  README.md
(base) krustyhack@KrustyMSI:~/linux-amd64$ ./helm version
(base) krustyhack@KrustyMSI:~/linux-amd64$ echo $?
1
(base) krustyhack@KrustyMSI:~/linux-amd64$
```

Did I missed something ? I'm on Ubuntu 18.04 and up to date.
